title: Topic Assessment Form (TAF)
blurb: Topic Assessment Form (TAF) submission is the initial step where the project topic and four main components are formally proposed and submitted for approval to secure topic selection.

title: Project Proposal
blurb: The proposal submission task was completed by submitting a comprehensive report detailing the research objectives, methodology, and expected outcomes for approval.

title: Progress Presentation I
blurb: Progress Presentation 1 (PP1) marks the review of approximately 50% project completion, revealing design gaps and inconsistencies, demonstrating functional features, and providing early validation of solutions.

title: Research Paper
blurb: Submitted research paper to ICAC 2025, contributing original findings to advance knowledge in computing, aligned with the conference theme on AI, Quantum, and future technologies.

title: Progress Presentation 2
blurb: Progress Presentation 2 (PP2) demonstrates 90% project completion, showcasing near-final system functionality and readiness for final evaluation.

title: Research logbook
blurb: The research logbook records daily progress and key activities of the project, including Status Documents 1 & 2, serving as a validated record of the projectâ€™s status and ensuring continuous tracking and transparency.

title: Final Presentation and Viva evaluations
blurb: The Final Presentation & Viva is an individual oral exam where each member defends their contribution, demonstrating understanding and involvement in the project, and answering questions to confirm their role and knowledge.
